oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Utilisation and quality of fodders from grass-lands in organic livestock production in Poland
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jankowska-Huflejt, Dr Halina
Wróbel, Dr Barbara
Kaca, Prof. Edmund
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pasture and forage crops
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During the years 2004-2005 the investigation of organic farms with livestock production with the questionnaire method and chemical analyses of fod-der from permanent grasslands were cared out. The structure of agriculture lands, type of livestock pro-duction, livestock density and fodders quality from grasslands were evaluated. The quality and quantity of fodders from organic farms was similar to feeds from conventional farms. Also the utilisation of grass-lands for livestock production was better on the stud-ied organic farms than on conventional farms. The high proportion of pastures suggest he proper direc-tion of grasslands utilisation and indicates better effectiveness of those lands in relation to conven-tional farms
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Jankowska-Huflejt, Dr Halina; Wróbel, Dr Barbara and Kaca, Prof. Edmund (2006) Utilisation and quality of fodders from grass-lands in organic livestock production in Poland. Paper at: Joint Organic Congress, Odense, Denmark, May 30-31, 2006.
